title: Sensor Sizes and Their Impact
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sensor Sizes and Their Impact.

hook.text: Full-frame, APS-C, Micro Four Thirds. Sensor size is the most important spec most buyers overlook.

buildup.text: Larger sensors collect more light per pixel, producing cleaner images with less noise â€” especially in low light.

discovery.text: Full-frame sensors match 35mm film dimensions. Crop sensors are smaller, multiplying focal length and cutting depth.

twist.text: Bigger isn't always better. Crop sensors are lighter, cheaper, and give telephoto reach â€” ideal for wildlife.

climax.text: Sensor size determines the look and capabilities of your system. It's the foundation every other decision builds on.

punchline.text: Sensor size matters more than megapixels. Always did.

quiz.question: What advantage do larger camera sensors provide?
options: More light per pixel resulting in cleaner low-light images
